intro: Octomeria concolor, commonly known as the smooth octomeris, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, forested areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
